Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. Steve catches your eye, and with a knowing wink suggests that you might like to buy a "somewhat fruity" film that came in yesterday. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. The assistant offers to sell you a black plastic bag. A screwdriver is for sale. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. A group of students swim by with what looks like the principal. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] north [STATE] Clothing Shop Behind a counter stands an assistant, ready to sell you anything in the shop. Many racks are filled with exciting jackets, a fashionable accessory in Hydropolis at the moment. You can leave the shop by going south. A trendy pair of sun glasses are on sale. A tie is for sale. [ACTION] buy glasses with fisa [STATE] Clothing Shop Behind a counter stands an assistant, ready to sell you anything in the shop. Many racks are filled with exciting jackets, a fashionable accessory in Hydropolis at the moment. You can leave the shop by going south. A trendy pair of sun glasses are on sale. A tie is for sale. [ACTION] buy glasses with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams exactly sir." You type in your Fish Identity Number to authorise the debit. The assistant waits for authorisation then returns your card, together with the dark glasses. [ACTION] south [STATE] "That will be 5 clams exactly sir." You type in your Fish Identity Number to authorise the debit. The assistant waits for authorisation then returns your card, together with the dark glasses. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] south [STATE] Police Station The police station is fished day and night by a stalwart dogfish who is ready to solve the troutiest of crimes, especially the really simple ones where the villains just confess. You can escape without much danger of pursuit to the north. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] down [STATE] Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] examine skeleton [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] examine skeleton [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus roamed the seas of Hydropolis until fish became civilised. Then they killed every single Bloodyenormasaurus they could lay their grubby little fins on, simply because they made such great museum exhibits. [ACTION] east [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus roamed the seas of Hydropolis until fish became civilised. Then they killed every single Bloodyenormasaurus they could lay their grubby little fins on, simply because they made such great museum exhibits. [ACTION] east [STATE] You swim through an exhibition of the use of gravel in modern science. The ingenious fish scientists have managed to produce materials so cunning that, even though they aren't really gravel, they behave in almost exactly the same way. Not entirely impressed, you swim back west. Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] north [STATE] You swim through an exhibition of the use of gravel in modern science. The ingenious fish scientists have managed to produce materials so cunning that, even though they aren't really gravel, they behave in almost exactly the same way. Not entirely impressed, you swim back west. Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Alarm Room White rooms always have a bad effect on you. If the authorities had had their way, your laboratory would have been white. But you were firm. You put your tail down and refused. This room is white, and you don't like it. It leads north to the museum's finest exhibit and south back to the museum. The ingenious fish scientists have managed to produce materials so cunning that, even though they aren't really gravel, they behave in almost exactly the same way. [ACTION] north [STATE] Bells, hooters and whistles sing out from all over the museum bringing guards rushing to the crystal room. You try to explain that it was an accident; that you just stumbled. Amazingly, the guards believe your story though they do look a bit suspicious as they deposit you back at the station and go back to their various posts. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] south [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] get skeleton [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] get skeleton [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus steadfastly refuses to be moved. [ACTION] look in skeleton [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus steadfastly refuses to be moved. [ACTION] look in skeleton [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus roamed the seas of Hydropolis until fish became civilised. Then they killed every single Bloodyenormasaurus they could lay their grubby little fins on, simply because they made such great museum exhibits. [ACTION] south [STATE] The bloodyenormasaurus roamed the seas of Hydropolis until fish became civilised. Only north, down. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Museum. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Museum. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. [ACTION] south [STATE] Tuna Day's Music Shop The music shop is cluttered with amateur musicians, most of whom are playing versions of the ancient heavy metal hit "Smoke Underwater", very badly, on expensive instruments that they have no intention of buying. An assistant is attempting to hide behind the counter. The hasty exit from this noisy place is north. [ACTION] examine music [STATE] Tuna Day's Music Shop The music shop is cluttered with amateur musicians, most of whom are playing versions of the ancient heavy metal hit "Smoke Underwater", very badly, on expensive instruments that they have no intention of buying. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. Steve catches your eye, and with a knowing wink suggests that you might like to buy a "somewhat fruity" film that came in yesterday. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] examine radio case [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. Steve catches your eye, and with a knowing wink suggests that you might like to buy a "somewhat fruity" film that came in yesterday. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Museum. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] north [STATE] The dark glasses and ear plugs provide just enough protection for the host-parasite interface from the flashing lights and heavy bass. You are completely safe. As long as you keep them on of course. Disco The university disco is open all day and every day during rag week. The students are having a wild and wacky sponsored bop-til-you-drop competition. They're having a whale of a time, pretending they're robots when the stroboscopic light is on and performing mindless synchronised dances to songs they'd normally only dance to if they were on holiday where no-one would remember them. You know it's all done for charity, but they look suspiciously like they're enjoying themselves. Some disco dancers are here. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. [ACTION] put tatty card in slot [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. [ACTION] put tatty card in slot [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] enter large warp [STATE] You swim into the large warp and your body changes into a strange hybrid creature, half-man half-fish. This must be Dr. Roach. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here. [ACTION] examine shelf [STATE] You swim into the large warp and your body changes into a strange hybrid creature, half-man half-fish. This must be Dr. Roach. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here. [ACTION] examine shelf [STATE] Dr. Roach bought the trendy black shelf from his favourite trendy black shelf shop. There is a fishofax on it. The wall behind your fishton glows, revealing the face of the principal's secretary. "Good morning Dr. Roach," she says, "I'm sorry to call so early, I just want to confirm that the principal is expecting you at ten o'clock this morning. Goodbye." Her face fades out, leaving you with the annoying jingle of the Hydropolis Telecommunications Network: "HTN, HTN - With your friends you can talk, and you won't have to walk, HTN, HTN". Not the most auspicious start to a morning. [ACTION] get fishofax [STATE] Dr. Roach bought the trendy black shelf from his favourite trendy black shelf shop. There is a fishofax on it. [ACTION] south [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and down to the ground floor. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here. A group of students swim by with what looks like the principal. [ACTION] east [STATE] A high speed police fish pulls up outside your apartment block. His flashing blue light and wailing siren make you feel decidedly uneasy. The host-parasite interface weakens momentarily and you catch a glimpse of the goldfish bowl. Then you regain control of Roach's body as the police fish zooms off. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] A high speed police fish pulls up outside your apartment block. His flashing blue light and wailing siren make you feel decidedly uneasy. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] south [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] south [STATE] "Good morning Dr. Roach," says the principal's secretary, "have a seat. She won't be long." She finally arrives at ten minutes to ten. "Good morning Doctor," says the principal as she closes the door and takes a seat, "I'm sorry if this is inconvenient, but it is an emergency. It seems this talk about parasiting may not be speculation. We've received information that a junior member of your team has been 'taken over' and has sabotaged The Project. You don't need me to tell you that this could be disastrous for Hydropolis. Naturally, I've suspended everyone until further notice. You're the only one I can trust; I want you to investigate. I'm going to the government to inform them of the danger. I'm not evacuating, so don't worry. I'll be back tomorrow." She gets up. "Now please hurry doctor. There's not a second to lose." You walk back to the foyer together then go your separate ways. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. An old fish swims up to you and asks for the price of a snifter. "Five clams," you tell him. He thanks you and swims away. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. As you arrive Bertie Bream greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. As you arrive Bertie Bream greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. Your colleague Bertie Bream swims into view. Bertie Bream greets you with a friendly wave of his fin. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. Steve catches your eye, and with a knowing wink suggests that you might like to buy a "somewhat fruity" film that came in yesterday. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Restaurant Bursting to the gills, this restaurant serves the finest plankton meals in Hydropolis. For the fabulously wealthy, gas-impregnated oils are on sale. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Alarm Room White rooms always have a bad effect on you. If the authorities had had their way, your laboratory would have been white. But you were firm. You put your tail down and refused. This room is white, and you don't like it. It leads north to the museum's finest exhibit and south back to the museum. [ACTION] open sachet [STATE] Alarm Room White rooms always have a bad effect on you. If the authorities had had their way, your laboratory would have been white. But you were firm. [ACTION] open sachet [STATE] You tear open the sachet. The plankton escapes and starts to slowly disperse in the water around you. You notice how the plankton deflects the light as it spreads. If you act quickly you should be able to eat it before it disperses completely. Your mouth drops open in amazement. In the spreading cloud of plankton is the glimmering of myriad light beams - clearly the museum alarm system. Ahem! [ACTION] north [STATE] You tear open the sachet. Crystal Room This is the most beautiful room you've ever seen. There are no decorations, no features, no flaws, and yet the colours shift and swirl on every surface creating a hypnotic, soothing ambience. If you ever get the urge to leave, the exit is south. A crystal is the museum's star exhibit. [ACTION] get crystal [STATE] You step past the now visible beams. Crystal Room This is the most beautiful room you've ever seen. If the authorities had had their way, your laboratory would have been white. But you were firm. You put your tail down and refused. This room is white, and you don't like it. It leads north to the museum's finest exhibit and south back to the museum. There are some beams and some plankton here. [ACTION] eat plankton [STATE] The plankton is delicious, and soon gone. Bells, hooters and whistles sing out from all over the museum bringing guards rushing to the crystal room. You try to explain that it was an accident; that you just stumbled. On your way out you are interviewed by a guard. "You've stolen our crystal haven't you, you thief!" In a moment of weakness, which ruins any chance you had of completing the game, you confess and tearfully hand the crystal back to him, promising never to do anything so naughty again. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] You wisely decide not to walk onto the tracks. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You wisely decide not to walk onto the tracks. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] west [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] north [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. Oh, no! You've been burgled! I hope Dr. Roach was insured. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] south [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] south [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Bertie Bream and Ernest Chub greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. As you arrive Simon Tench greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] time [STATE] The time is 13:24 [ACTION] east [STATE] The time is 13:24 [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] wear glasses [STATE] You are carrying a fishofax, a tatty card, a new card, a travel pass, a screwdriver, some dark glasses, some ear-plugs, a hyperdriver, a crystal, a film and a sachet. You are wearing a watch. [ACTION] wear glasses [STATE] You put on the dark glasses. [ACTION] wear plugs [STATE] You put on the dark glasses. [ACTION] wear plugs [STATE] You put on the ear-plugs. The ear plugs don't work too well. You can still work out what people say. "On your marks, get set, GO!" Three pairs of students, tied together come rushing past you. It's a two-tail race, obviously a ploy to raise money for rag week. Then hordes of students swim by, rattling collecting tins. It's a good job they don't take Fisa. They swim off. [ACTION] north [STATE] The dark glasses and ear plugs provide just enough protection for the host-parasite interface from the flashing lights and heavy bass. You are completely safe. As long as you keep them on of course. Disco The university disco is open all day and every day during rag week. The students are having a wild and wacky sponsored bop-til-you-drop competition. They're having a whale of a time, pretending they're robots when the stroboscopic light is on and performing mindless synchronised dances to songs they'd normally only dance to if they were on holiday where no-one would remember them. You know it's all done for charity, but they look suspiciously like they're enjoying themselves. Some disco dancers are here. [ACTION] wait for chub [STATE] The dark glasses and ear plugs provide just enough protection for the host-parasite interface from the flashing lights and heavy bass. You are completely safe. [ACTION] look [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] look [STATE] Disco The university disco is open all day and every day during rag week. The students are having a wild and wacky sponsored bop-til-you-drop competition. They're having a whale of a time, pretending they're robots when the stroboscopic light is on and performing mindless synchronised dances to songs they'd normally only dance to if they were on holiday where no-one would remember them. You know it's all done for charity, but they look suspiciously like they're enjoying themselves. Some disco dancers are here. You notice several students loitering with intent. One of them produces a guitar and starts singing: "Come on feel my nose. The girls grab my clothes. Go why, why why any more." Oh no, he's started busking! Luckily the other students attack and carry him off before you hear too much. [ACTION] look [STATE] Disco The university disco is open all day and every day during rag week. [ACTION] time [STATE] The time is 14:01 [ACTION] south [STATE] The time is 14:01 [ACTION] south [STATE] "I've been standing here for ages," says Bertie Bream , "come on, let's go in." Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] north [STATE] "I've been standing here for ages," says Bertie Bream , "come on, let's go in." Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. [ACTION] north [STATE] Suddenly, Bertie Bream gets very nervous and drags you away from the entrance. "I can't go in without a tie," he says, "what will everyone think of me?" He starts shaking uncontrollably. "You'll have to get me one," he quivers, "I can't swim anywhere right now." [ACTION] time [STATE] The time is 13:26 [ACTION] west [STATE] The time is 13:26 [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] north [STATE] "Thanks," says Bertie Bream , putting on the tie, "I feel quite presentable now. Let's go in." [ACTION] north [STATE] The dark glasses and ear plugs provide just enough protection for the host-parasite interface from the flashing lights and heavy bass. You are completely safe. As long as you keep them on of course. Bertie Bream follows you in."Aghhh!" Bertie Bream screams and rushes from the disco. You quickly follow, just in time to see his body convulsing. There is a popping noise as something escapes through a warp hole then Bertie Bream collapses. You slap his gills to bring him round. "What happened?" he says, standing up, "I can hardly remember anything. But I did something bad to The Project. Something about stream regulators, stream accelerators, stream regimentors." "Go on," you say, "It's terribly important." "I can't remember," he pleads, getting delirious, "it's not my fault, I really can't. I need a shower. I feel dirty." He rushes off before you can stop him. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. There is a popping noise as something escapes through a warp hole then Bertie Bream collapses. You slap his gills to bring him round. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. [ACTION] read wallchart [STATE] A: filter (out of stock) B: photon bridge (out of stock) C: focus wheel (out of stock) D: tuned crystal (out of stock) E: a suitable case (out of stock) F: shelf (out of stock) G: wallplan (1 in stock) [ACTION] northwest [STATE] A: filter (out of stock) B: photon bridge (out of stock) C: focus wheel (out of stock) D: tuned crystal (out of stock) E: a suitable case (out of stock) F: shelf (out of stock) G: wallplan (1 in stock) [ACTION] northwest [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. [ACTION] west [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] west [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. "On your marks, get set, GO!" Three pairs of students, tied together come rushing past you. It's a two-tail race, obviously a ploy to raise money for rag week. Then hordes of students swim by, rattling collecting tins. It's a good job they don't take Fisa. They swim off. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy bridge [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! [ACTION] north [STATE] The stream accelerator accelerates particles gathered by the main Project machine. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] put crystal in case [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] "Rod," calls Steve, "come here and put the fishton in the van for delivery later on." Rod appears from a back room, gives you a knowing wink, and leaves with the goods safely in his charge. "It's all right I know your address," Steve says as you offer the information. He takes your credit card and partly fills in a sales slip which he informs you will be duly completed "Later" and returns the card to you with a supercilious "Thank you sir."
