[ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] yes [STATE] [ACTION] look [STATE] [ACTION] look [STATE] Goldfish Bowl Swimming upside down is good fun, but difficult, even for someone as highly trained as yourself. It looks like the pondweed is dangling from the gravel above your head. And the ant eggs, wow! Upside down they look, so, so much like, well, like exactly the same as if you were the right way up actually. Anyway, there's no need to get carried away. Sir Playfair has a message for you in the castle if you're not mistaken and he hates agents who are late. Someone is tampering with the figures and The Project! All staff are advised to remain vigilant regarding all suspicious data and misuse of computer time. Let's nip this problem in the bud, boys. Time 14:44: # [ACTION] project [STATE] Opah University 660/55/4 Project notes For Project Members Eyes only: From - A. Roach Project Prime Directive: To save Hydropolis, which is under threat from water evaporation, by streaming water from an alternate dimension - Fractal Aquaria Two. The inter-dimensional matter streamer will be referred to as The Device from now on. Roach Project Prime Directive: To save Hydropolis, which is under threat from water evaporation, by streaming water from an alternate dimension - Fractal Aquaria Two. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine protocopier [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine protocopier [STATE] The protocopier is a large box with a slot on one side and a simple on-off switch where you would expect one, built by Dr. Salmon as a prototype Device. While it is indeed remarkable, the University authorities took a different view for two reasons: the protocopier used so much power that fuel bills reached record levels and secondly, it could only teleport in very small amounts of water. It was the downfall of Dr. Salmon; he was fired by the principal. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. "On your marks, get set, GO!" Three pairs of students, tied together come rushing past you. It's a two-tail race, obviously a ploy to raise money for rag week. Then hordes of students swim by, rattling collecting tins. It's a good job they don't take Fisa. They swim off. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] examine salmon [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] examine salmon [STATE] All washed up, Doctor Salmon is a no-good drunk. He hasn't been the same since he was taken off The Project. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. You are wearing a watch, some dark glasses and some ear-plugs. [ACTION] examine sachet [STATE] The sachet is used by customers who wish to take their food away to eat at home. It is open. [ACTION] look [STATE] The sachet is used by customers who wish to take their food away to eat at home. It is open. [ACTION] look [STATE] aboratory (at the Project terminal) This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] north [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. [ACTION] up [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] examine trapdoor [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] stand [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] west [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Pickerel. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] north [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] "Rod," calls Steve, "come here and put the fishton in the van for delivery later on." Rod appears from a back room, gives you a knowing wink, and leaves with the goods safely in his charge. "It's all right I know your address," Steve says as you offer the information. He takes your credit card and partly fills in a sales slip which he informs you will be duly completed "Later" and returns the card to you with a supercilious "Thank you sir." Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] You get off. Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] Dr. Roach certainly knows how to build impressive machines - this one nearly fills the project room. It looks a bit like a huge aquarium, filled to the brim with multi-coloured gravel and, if you and Sir Playfair have anything to do with it, it's going to save Hydropolis from water evaporation. It almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. It contains a stream accelerator. [ACTION] open accelerator [STATE] You can't do that to the stream accelerator. [ACTION] get lok screw [STATE] You can't do that to the stream accelerator. [ACTION] get lok screw [STATE] You just can't seem to get a grip on the Lokscrew(TM). You need a hyperdriver. [ACTION] unscrew lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] You just can't seem to get a grip on the Lokscrew(TM). You need a hyperdriver. [ACTION] unscrew lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] One of the special features of Lokscrews(TM) that make them popular with games programmers is their ability to lock tight just when things are getting critical. This is one such occasion. The computer is counting down the destruction of Hydropolis and time is running out. The Lokscrew(TM) won't move when locked. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy mask [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy mask [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give mask to salmon [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give mask to salmon [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. "You're getting through the snifters quickly." adds Steve, "If you like, I can sell you a cylinder for only 99 clams." [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. "You're getting through the snifters quickly." adds Steve, "If you like, I can sell you a cylinder for only 99 clams." [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. "Well, you really messed that up," Sir Playfair scolds. "The cylinder must be important otherwise they wouldn't have stolen it. Fortunately, the back room boys got a fix on him. He's somewhere in the dimensions. You'll have to go after him, Agent 10, and be careful this time." You hear him mumbling in the background then he curtly says, "A warp will open up in Dr. Roach's apartment. Use that. Panchax out." You should be more careful if you want to keep your job. [ACTION] east [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] down [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] down [STATE] You can't go that way. Only north, northeast, east, southeast, south, west, northwest. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You can't go that way. Only north, northeast, east, southeast, south, west, northwest. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train is so crowded that the doors just miss your tail when they close. The train rumbles into the tunnel with its heavy, sweating load. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] up [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] west [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] west [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] up [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] up [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a dark warp here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a dark warp here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] You slip through the dark warp into the whirling dimensions. "It's a strange place Agent 10," says Sir Playfair's voice in the back of your brain. "Those Fins have twisted the dimensions into some kind of labyrinth, but it isn't normal. The back room boys are busy trying to figure it out. All they can tell me is that the Fins have hidden the cylinder in a place where the only way out is up and that if you're left in a room with no exits you'll be stuck there until we can get you out, which may well be too late to save Hydropolis. You'll have to watch your step, Agent 10; we don't want to lose you, old boy. Good luck. Panchax out." In The Dimensions A lesser being would have no idea what's going on here. Their brains would probably get lightly scrambled if not completely fizzled out. But, for a highly trained inter-dimensional espionage operative, who has spent half his life travelling through the dimensions, exits are easy to spot. Exits lead northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, up. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] You slip through the dark warp into the whirling dimensions. "It's a strange place Agent 10," says Sir Playfair's voice in the back of your brain. "Those Fins have twisted the dimensions into some kind of labyrinth, but it isn't normal. The back room boys are busy trying to figure it out. But, for a highly trained inter-dimensional espionage operative, who has spent half his life travelling through the dimensions, exits are easy to spot. There is a travel pass here. [ACTION] up [STATE] "Well done old boy," says Sir Playfair as you slip back into the lounge, "I didn't think you'd make it. That should keep the Fins at bay for a while. Top hole. Panchax out." The dark warp swiftly fades. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. [ACTION] south [STATE] The cylinder smells like a cylinder. [ACTION] south [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and down to the ground floor. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] south [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You wisely decide not to walk onto the tracks. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] south [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] south [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] give cylinder to salmon [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. The drunk plays with your thoughtful present. He unfortunately finds how to empty the cylinder. The gas escapes, all in one go. What a waste. [ACTION] attach mask to cylinder [STATE] You can't do that with the snifter. [ACTION] wear mask [STATE] You can't do that with the snifter. [ACTION] wear mask [STATE] You put on the snifter. As you inhale, someone kicks you in the gills. At least, that's what it feels like. Actually, you keel over backwards and swim upside down out of the pub, but you can't remember that. The drunk thought it was funny though. You do remember going round and round the tube network before you could get off at Paddlington. Coming up the access funnel was difficult, but, now that you're back in your apartment, the snifter has thankfully worn off, leaving you with a sore head. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a travel pass and a tatty card here. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] inventory [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] up [STATE] "Well done old boy," says Sir Playfair as you slip back into the lounge, "I didn't think you'd make it. That should keep the Fins at bay for a while. Top hole. Panchax out." The dark warp swiftly fades. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and down to the ground floor. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] south [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] east [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] east [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. The assistant offers to sell you a black plastic bag. [ACTION] buy bag with fisa [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. The assistant waits for authorisation then returns your card, together with the bag. [ACTION] west [STATE] "That will be 2 clams exactly sir." [ACTION] south [STATE] Tuna Day's Music Shop The music shop is cluttered with amateur musicians, most of whom are playing versions of the ancient heavy metal hit "Smoke Underwater", very badly, on expensive instruments that they have no intention of buying. An assistant is attempting to hide behind the counter. The hasty exit from this noisy place is north. [ACTION] west [STATE] You wait for a break in the traffic but it's far too busy so you give up. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] out [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] eat eggs [STATE] It's a pity that ant eggs are all you've had to eat for the past week, otherwise they might look appetising. [ACTION] eat eggs [STATE] Delicious and there are plenty more. Suddenly, the ant eggs start dissipating a pale pink solution. Oh no! It's an inter-dimensional espionage operative's worst nightmare - the dreaded pink anti inter-dimensional espionage operative poison, guaranteed to kill not only an inter-dimensional espionage operative's host, but to trap him there for ever. To put it bluntly, the guarantee hasn't run out. The poison gags your gills. You'll never see Sir Playfair or Mission HQ again. Your score is 349 out of 501. You have died. Do you want to quit or restart (q/r)? [ACTION] yes [STATE] Delicious and there are plenty more. Suddenly, the ant eggs start dissipating a pale pink solution. Oh no! It's an inter-dimensional espionage operative's worst nightmare - the dreaded pink anti inter-dimensional espionage operative poison, guaranteed to kill not only an inter-dimensional espionage operative's host, but to trap him there for ever. To put it bluntly, the guarantee hasn't run out. The poison gags your gills. You'll never see Sir Playfair or Mission HQ again. Your score is 349 out of 501. You have died. Do you want to quit or restart (q/r)? [ACTION] yes [STATE] "Well done, Agent 10," said Sir Playfair Panchax, head of Mission HQ. "We knew you'd stop the Seven Deadly Fins. Good show! It's a shame they got away again. But now I suggest you take a vacation. You've earned it, old boy." You agreed with him, the last few months had been a real chore. Being an inter-dimensional espionage operative isn't a bad life apart from the pain of warping and the inconvenience of host-parasite relationships, but you need a spot of R and R every now and then, just to stay sane. So you went for the big one - warping into a goldfish for a whole month! The peace. The tranquility. And you're still on the payroll. FISH! - Version 1.10 - Copyright (C) 1988, 1990 Magnetic Scrolls Ltd. Someone's coming. Good, it must be time for food. SPLATTO. A hand as big as a bus drops something hard right on your head. Understandably dazed, you flip over and, through a swirl of ant eggs, spot what hit you: a tacky plastic castle. It looks like a rush job. Sir Playfair must be in trouble. And you thought you were on vacation... Goldfish Bowl Swimming upside down is good fun, but difficult, even for someone as highly trained as yourself. It looks like the pondweed is dangling from the gravel above your head. And the ant eggs, wow! Upside down they look, so, so much like, well, like exactly the same as if you were the right way up actually. Anyway, there's no need to get carried away. Sir Playfair has a message for you in the castle if you're not mistaken and he hates agents who are late. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy snifter [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy snifter with fisa [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy snifter with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give snifter to salmon [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give snifter to salmon [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy snifter with fisa [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy snifter with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. "You're getting through the snifters quickly." adds Steve, "If you like, I can sell you a cylinder for only 99 clams." [ACTION] give snifter to salmon [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. "You're getting through the snifters quickly." adds Steve, "If you like, I can sell you a cylinder for only 99 clams." [ACTION] give snifter to salmon [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. "Well, you really messed that up," Sir Playfair scolds. "The cylinder must be important otherwise they wouldn't have stolen it. Fortunately, the back room boys got a fix on him. He's somewhere in the dimensions. You'll have to go after him, Agent 10, and be careful this time." You hear him mumbling in the background then he curtly says, "A warp will open up in Dr. Roach's apartment. Use that. Panchax out." You should be more careful if you want to keep your job. [ACTION] east [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears.
