[ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Paddlington. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Paddlington Station This station is busy. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] This fish has not been modified to swim through walls. [ACTION] west [STATE] This fish has not been modified to swim through walls. [ACTION] west [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] up [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] up [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and up to the level of your apartment Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a dark warp here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a dark warp here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] You slip through the dark warp into the whirling dimensions. "It's a strange place Agent 10," says Sir Playfair's voice in the back of your brain. "Those Fins have twisted the dimensions into some kind of labyrinth, but it isn't normal. The back room boys are busy trying to figure it out. All they can tell me is that the Fins have hidden the cylinder in a place where the only way out is up and that if you're left in a room with no exits you'll be stuck there until we can get you out, which may well be too late to save Hydropolis. You'll have to watch your step, Agent 10; we don't want to lose you, old boy. Good luck. Panchax out." In The Dimensions A lesser being would have no idea what's going on here. Their brains would probably get lightly scrambled if not completely fizzled out. But, for a highly trained inter-dimensional espionage operative, who has spent half his life travelling through the dimensions, exits are easy to spot. Exits lead east, south, southwest. [ACTION] east [STATE] You slip through the dark warp into the whirling dimensions. "It's a strange place Agent 10," says Sir Playfair's voice in the back of your brain. [ACTION] drop film [STATE] Film dropped. [ACTION] get cylinder [STATE] Film dropped. [ACTION] get cylinder [STATE] You have now got the cylinder. [ACTION] up [STATE] You have now got the cylinder. [ACTION] up [STATE] "Well done old boy," says Sir Playfair as you slip back into the lounge, "I didn't think you'd make it. That should keep the Fins at bay for a while. Top hole. Panchax out." The dark warp swiftly fades. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. [ACTION] inventory [STATE] "Well done old boy," says Sir Playfair as you slip back into the lounge, "I didn't think you'd make it. That should keep the Fins at bay for a while. Top hole. Panchax out." The dark warp swiftly fades. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. [ACTION] inventory [STATE] You are carrying a fishofax, a tatty card, a new card, a travel pass, a screwdriver, a hyperdriver, a crystal, a sachet and a cylinder. You are wearing a watch, some dark glasses and some ear-plugs. [ACTION] drop sachet [STATE] You are carrying a fishofax, a tatty card, a new card, a travel pass, a screwdriver, a hyperdriver, a crystal, a sachet and a cylinder. You are wearing a watch, some dark glasses and some ear-plugs. [ACTION] drop sachet [STATE] Sachet dropped. [ACTION] south [STATE] Sachet dropped. [ACTION] south [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] Landing There are two doors on this level of the apartment block - one to your apartment and one to your new neighbour, Ernest Chub's. Beside each door is a handprint and an access shaft leads down to the lobby. [ACTION] down [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and down to the ground floor. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] south [STATE] You swim into the access shaft and down to the ground floor. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] south [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Paddlington. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Barbellican. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Barbellican. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train is so crowded that the doors just miss your tail when they close. The train rumbles into the tunnel with its heavy, sweating load. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train is so crowded that the doors just miss your tail when they close. The train rumbles into the tunnel with its heavy, sweating load. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Pickerel. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Pickerel. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] south [STATE] Time passes. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "Mind the gap," shouts the guard. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. A pike stops the doors closing to allow his aggressive mates on then the train rushes off into the tunnel. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] As you step on the road, the cars all accelerate towards you, their drivers leaning over the steering wheels with fangs bared. You just avoid them by swimming as quick as you can to the safety of Dace Road. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] east [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. The assistant offers to sell you a black plastic bag. [ACTION] buy bag with fisa [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. The assistant offers to sell you a black plastic bag. [ACTION] buy bag with fisa [STATE] "That will be 2 clams exactly sir." You type in your Fish Identity Number to authorise the debit. The assistant waits for authorisation then returns your card, together with the bag. You are carrying too much and the fishofax annoyingly falls to the ground. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. [ACTION] east [STATE] "I've been standing here for ages," says Bertie Bream , "come on, let's go in." Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] put new card in slot [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] put new card in slot [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] north [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] north [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] put bag on cylinder [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] put bag on cylinder [STATE] You can't do that to the cylinder. [ACTION] cylinder in bag [STATE] You can't do that to the cylinder. [ACTION] cylinder in bag [STATE] Are you talking to yourself again? [ACTION] put cylinder in bag [STATE] Are you talking to yourself again? [ACTION] put cylinder in bag [STATE] The cylinder is now inside the bag. [ACTION] open cylinder [STATE] The cylinder is now inside the bag. [ACTION] open cylinder [STATE] The bag inflates and you hold it tightly closed to prevent the gas escaping. You rise up through the tower. There is a loud bang as you pass through the trap door, opening it. The roof of the tower lies inches below you but you are drifting slowly upwards. Roof When there was a lot of water around, students came up here to watch the teeming city of Hydropolis. A railing around the edge of the roof was put here to prevent them being washed away by the deceptively strong overcurrent. Now the water has gone that has ceased to be a problem. The obvious exit is the trapdoor. There is a photon bridge and some railings here. [ACTION] examine railings [STATE] The bag inflates and you hold it tightly closed to prevent the gas escaping. You rise up through the tower. There is a loud bang as you pass through the trap door, opening it. The roof of the tower lies inches below you but you are drifting slowly upwards. Roof When there was a lot of water around, students came up here to watch the teeming city of Hydropolis. A railing around the edge of the roof was put here to prevent them being washed away by the deceptively strong overcurrent. Now the water has gone that has ceased to be a problem. The obvious exit is the trapdoor. There is a photon bridge and some railings here. [ACTION] examine railings [STATE] When there was more water in Hydropolis, students used to come up here to admire Hydropolis. Lots of them were swept over the edge by the overcurrent so some railings were kindly put up. This is fun isn't it? You've drifted even higher now. You are finding breathing a little difficult, however, but Hydropolis is stunning from this height. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] When there was more water in Hydropolis, students used to come up here to admire Hydropolis. Lots of them were swept over the edge by the overcurrent so some railings were kindly put up. This is fun isn't it? You've drifted even higher now. You are finding breathing a little difficult, however, but Hydropolis is stunning from this height. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] You let go of the bag and fall at an alarming pace. Roach is clearly disturbed, falling is not one of his greatest skills. With a sickening SPLAT you strike the surface, bursting like a balloon full of water hitting a concrete floor. That was fun. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. [ACTION] open bag [STATE] You let go of the bag and fall at an alarming pace. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. [ACTION] open bag [STATE] You let go of the bag and fall at an alarming pace. Roach is clearly disturbed, falling is not one of his greatest skills. With a sickening SPLAT you strike the surface, bursting like a balloon full of water hitting a concrete floor. That was fun. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. Oh well, falling is quite good fun. Until you hit the shallow water and slam into the floor that is. [ACTION] climb railings [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] climb railings [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. Roach has never practiced falling before, it's a good job your training as an inter-dimensional espionage operative has given you the experience to be able to survive under such difficult circumstances. You hit the water below the tower making a dramatic entrance to Opah. Several of the students applaud your efforts. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] east [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] inventory [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . You are wearing a watch, some dark glasses and some ear-plugs. [ACTION] east [STATE] You are carrying a fishofax, a tatty card, a new card, a travel pass, a hyperdriver, a crystal and a photon bridge. You are wearing a watch, some dark glasses and some ear-plugs. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. [ACTION] put tatty card in slot [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. [ACTION] put tatty card in slot [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] east [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] east [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. Exits are northeast, southeast and west through the metal door to the corridor. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. Exits are northeast, southeast and west through the metal door to the corridor. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine protocopier [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine protocopier [STATE] The protocopier is a large box with a slot on one side and a simple on-off switch where you would expect one, built by Dr. Salmon as a prototype Device. While it is indeed remarkable, the University authorities took a different view for two reasons: the protocopier used so much power that fuel bills reached record levels and secondly, it could only teleport in very small amounts of water. It was the downfall of Dr. Salmon; he was fired by the principal. [ACTION] examine slot [STATE] The protocopier is a large box with a slot on one side and a simple on-off switch where you would expect one, built by Dr. Salmon as a prototype Device. While it is indeed remarkable, the University authorities took a different view for two reasons: the protocopier used so much power that fuel bills reached record levels and secondly, it could only teleport in very small amounts of water. It was the downfall of Dr. Salmon; he was fired by the principal. [ACTION] examine slot [STATE] The slot is about as thick as a piece of paper. Three pairs of students, tied together come rushing past you. It's a two-tail race, obviously a ploy to raise money for rag week. Then hordes of students swim by, rattling collecting tins. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] show bridge to tench [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] down [STATE] Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Battersea. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Battersea. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train is so crowded that the doors just miss your tail when they close. The train rumbles into the tunnel with its heavy, sweating load. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train is so crowded that the doors just miss your tail when they close. The train rumbles into the tunnel with its heavy, sweating load. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Opah University. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Opah University. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. This is fun isn't it? You've drifted even higher now. You are finding breathing a little difficult, however, but Hydropolis is stunning from this height. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. This is fun isn't it? You've drifted even higher now. You are finding breathing a little difficult, however, but Hydropolis is stunning from this height. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] You release the bag, and it floats gently up into the sky. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You release the bag, and it floats gently up into the sky. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. Roach has never practiced falling before, it's a good job your training as an inter-dimensional espionage operative has given you the experience to be able to survive under such difficult circumstances. You hit the water below the tower making a dramatic entrance to Opah. Several of the students applaud your efforts. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] east [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] east [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] south [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] south [STATE] Library Containing the sum total of fish knowledge, this library is the best in all Hydropolis. As fish only have small brains, it is on the smallish side, but students spend a lot of time here delving into what knowledge there is - even during rag week. The library's rarest book lies on a lectern close to the exit in the north wall. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] Time passes. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] You release the bag, and it floats gently up into the sky. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You release the bag, and it floats gently up into the sky. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] get railings [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] get railings [STATE] The railings steadfastly refuse to be moved. Fish cannot survive without water. Roach's gills dry out and are rendered useless. The effect is fatal. These things happen, don't blame yourself. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] The railings steadfastly refuse to be moved. Fish cannot survive without water. Roach's gills dry out and are rendered useless. The effect is fatal. These things happen, don't blame yourself. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. Roach has never practiced falling before, it's a good job your training as an inter-dimensional espionage operative has given you the experience to be able to survive under such difficult circumstances. You hit the water below the tower making a dramatic entrance to Opah. Several of the students applaud your efforts. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] west [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. Roach has never practiced falling before, it's a good job your training as an inter-dimensional espionage operative has given you the experience to be able to survive under such difficult circumstances. You hit the water below the tower making a dramatic entrance to Opah. Several of the students applaud your efforts. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] west [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] "Please get me a tie. I'll wait here for you," says Bertie Bream . Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] examine door [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] examine door [STATE] The steel door opens automatically when the pressure from the turbines in the area to the west falls below danger levels. For safety reasons, it cannot be opened by hand. It is closed. [ACTION] examine gauge [STATE] The steel door opens automatically when the pressure from the turbines in the area to the west falls below danger levels. For safety reasons, it cannot be opened by hand. It is closed. [ACTION] examine gauge [STATE] The important gauge shows the total electricity output of the Battersea sub-station. It is currently displaying a value of 100. [ACTION] examine switch [STATE] The important gauge shows the total electricity output of the Battersea sub-station. It is currently displaying a value of 100. [ACTION] examine switch [STATE] The switch is just like those seen in fifties science-fiction movies, requiring both hands to turn it on or off. It controls the power supply to the whole of the tube system. At the moment it is on. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] The switch is just like those seen in fifties science-fiction movies, requiring both hands to turn it on or off. It controls the power supply to the whole of the tube system. At the moment it is on. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. [ACTION] west [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. [ACTION] west [STATE] The pressure door is closed to protect fish like you from swimming into the proximity of the fast moving blades which lie beyond. You may not appreciate this extra protection but I'm sure Dr. Roach is delighted. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. [ACTION] time [STATE] The time is 13:27 [ACTION] east [STATE] The time is 13:27 [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] south [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] south [STATE] Library Containing the sum total of fish knowledge, this library is the best in all Hydropolis. As fish only have small brains, it is on the smallish side, but students spend a lot of time here delving into what knowledge there is - even during rag week. The library's rarest book lies on a lectern close to the exit in the north wall. "On your marks, get set, GO!" Three pairs of students, tied together come rushing past you. It's a two-tail race, obviously a ploy to raise money for rag week. Then hordes of students swim by, rattling collecting tins. It's a good job they don't take Fisa. They swim off. [ACTION] open book [STATE] Library Containing the sum total of fish knowledge, this library is the best in all Hydropolis. [ACTION] tear page [STATE] You will have to tear the page out first. [ACTION] tear page [STATE] There is a loud ripping noise as you tear the page from the book. Several of the students look your way. One of them wanders over. "What's going on here?" he demands, noticing your vandalism. "Destroying library property, eh?" he continues, pushing you out into the corridor. "Sod off and don't come back." For some reason he doesn't take the page from you. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] put page in slot [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. A ticket clerk sits behind a counter selling tickets to fish who lack the simple foresight to buy a pass. You can leave the station through the exit to the east. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] east [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] "Rod," calls Steve, "come here and put the fishton in the van for delivery later on." Rod appears from a back room, gives you a knowing wink, and leaves with the goods safely in his charge. "It's all right I know your address," Steve says as you offer the information. He takes your credit card and partly fills in a sales slip which he informs you will be duly completed "Later" and returns the card to you with a supercilious "Thank you sir." The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] where is bertie [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] west [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here.
