[ACTION] east [STATE] Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. Whoom! The pressure door opens. [ACTION] west [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. Whoom! The pressure door opens. [ACTION] west [STATE] Tunnel You'll have to be very careful in this tunnel; the sharp blades of a giant turbine are all around you. They aren't spinning but the turbine could start up again at any moment so it's important not to panic. Just make up your mind quickly whether you're going to swim east back to the power station or further along the tunnel to the west. There is a turbine here. [ACTION] west [STATE] Tunnel You'll have to be very careful in this tunnel; the sharp blades of a giant turbine are all around you. They aren't spinning but the turbine could start up again at any moment so it's important not to panic. Just make up your mind quickly whether you're going to swim east back to the power station or further along the tunnel to the west. There is a turbine here. [ACTION] west [STATE] Curve The tunnel curves upwards here through still, calm water, coming to a halt at a series of grilles. The turbine's sharp blades lie to the east. [ACTION] examine grilles [STATE] Curve The tunnel curves upwards here through still, calm water, coming to a halt at a series of grilles. The turbine's sharp blades lie to the east. [ACTION] examine grilles [STATE] The grilles are an intricate criss-cross of filters, screwed together, designed to stop bits of rubbish getting into the turbine. There is a filter on them. [ACTION] unscrew grilles with screwdriver [STATE] The grilles are an intricate criss-cross of filters, screwed together, designed to stop bits of rubbish getting into the turbine. There is a filter on them. [ACTION] unscrew grilles with screwdriver [STATE] You can't do that to the grilles. [ACTION] unscrew filter with screwdriver [STATE] You can't do that to the grilles. [ACTION] unscrew filter with screwdriver [STATE] The screw is a little sticky to begin with but after a good twist it loosens up. The screw drops into your hands and with a little extra pressure you remove the filter. [ACTION] east [STATE] The screw is a little sticky to begin with but after a good twist it loosens up. The screw drops into your hands and with a little extra pressure you remove the filter. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. "Well, you really messed that up," Sir Playfair scolds. "The cylinder must be important otherwise they wouldn't have stolen it. Fortunately, the back room boys got a fix on him. He's somewhere in the dimensions. You'll have to go after him, Agent 10, and be careful this time." You hear him mumbling in the background then he curtly says, "A warp will open up in Dr. Roach's apartment. Use that. Panchax out." You should be more careful if you want to keep your job. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. If you require anything the assistant will only be too pleased to take your credit, if not your credit card. He may even give it back. You can leave the shop by swimming west. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Hardware Shop This hardware shop contains everything for the fish with DIY leanings. If your DIY is leaning, this is were you can get the tools to mend it. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] Time passes. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. The train speeds through the tunnel then clatters into Museum. The doors slide open and the commuters swim in and out. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. Abruptly, everything starts heading towards a certain point, accompanied by a grotesque sucking noise. Before you have time to react you are surrounded by a blinding white light which rapidly expands to engulf the whole of Hydropolis. Then silence. You are nothing but a handful of minute particles floating in free space. "You blew that, didn't you?" Sir Playfair Panchax is clearly not amused. "We'll try and get you back to your bowl, but I've got some bad news. The Fins have located you. They're out for revenge. Keep your head old chap, this could be nasty. Panchax out." You are dumped back in the fishbowl. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. "You complete Halibut!" shouts Sir Playfair Panchax. He doesn't sound happy at all. "We warned you not to damage Dr. Roach's body. He was the only one who could save Hydropolis. The Fins have won and are out to get you. There is nothing we at Mission HQ can do." The good news is you've been sent back to the bowl. The bad news is that the dimensional warps have disappeared. It looks like you're in big trouble. [ACTION] examine time [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] enter large warp [STATE] You swim into the large warp and your body changes into a strange hybrid creature, half-man half-fish. This must be Dr. Roach. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here. [ACTION] examine watch [STATE] You swim into the large warp and your body changes into a strange hybrid creature, half-man half-fish. This must be Dr. Roach. Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. There is a fishton here. [ACTION] examine watch [STATE] The time is 09:01 The wall behind your fishton glows, revealing the face of the principal's secretary. "Good morning Dr. Roach," she says, "I'm sorry to call so early, I just want to confirm that the principal is expecting you at ten o'clock this morning. Goodbye." Her face fades out, leaving you with the annoying jingle of the Hydropolis Telecommunications Network: "HTN, HTN - With your friends you can talk, and you won't have to walk, HTN, HTN". Not the most auspicious start to a morning. [ACTION] get fishofax [STATE] The time is 09:01 The wall behind your fishton glows, revealing the face of the principal's secretary. Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] east [STATE] A high speed police fish pulls up outside your apartment block. His flashing blue light and wailing siren make you feel decidedly uneasy. The host-parasite interface weakens momentarily and you catch a glimpse of the goldfish bowl. Then you regain control of Roach's body as the police fish zooms off. Paddlington Station This station is busy. Commuters are flooding down the access funnel to the platform, almost overwhelming the guard checking their tickets. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] south [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. [ACTION] buy mask with fisa [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give mask to drunk [STATE] "That will be 5 clams, sir. I'll charge it to your Fisa account at once. Enjoy your sniff." says Steve as he hands you a mask. [ACTION] give mask to drunk [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] east [STATE] The drunk takes the mask, holds it to his face and inhales deeply. After several deep breaths he returns the snifter to Steve."I needed that," he says, "I'd give you a token of my thanks, but I'm destitute." [ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. Steve catches your eye, and with a knowing wink suggests that you might like to buy a "somewhat fruity" film that came in yesterday. You recognise the fishton. There is a radio case here. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Second Hand Shop This shop is run by a cool catfish of many talents, most of them illegal, who goes by the name of Steve. Steve is a fish who could sell stripes to tiger sharks, but would rather sell them his grandmother - if he hasn't already. The shop has a bad reputation. It normally sells "fins what have fallen off the back of a submarine" if you get my drift. The exit from this den of low morals and high prices is to the south. [ACTION] buy fishton with fisa [STATE] "Rod," calls Steve, "come here and put the fishton in the van for delivery later on." Rod appears from a back room, gives you a knowing wink, and leaves with the goods safely in his charge. "It's all right I know your address," Steve says as you offer the information. He takes your credit card and partly fills in a sales slip which he informs you will be duly completed "Later" and returns the card to you with a supercilious "Thank you sir." The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. [ACTION] north [STATE] This fish has not been modified to swim through walls. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] Pickerel Underground Station This station is teeming with guppies, nipping in and out of the access funnel which leads to the platform. A guard, looking rather bored with life, checks all their tickets. You can buy tickets from the ticket clerk, behind his counter close to the exit southeast. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Pickerel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] south [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] south [STATE] "Good morning Doctor," says the principal as she closes the door and takes a seat, "I'm sorry if this is inconvenient, but it is an emergency. It seems this talk about parasiting may not be speculation. We've received information that a junior member of your team has been 'taken over' and has sabotaged The Project. You don't need me to tell you that this could be disastrous for Hydropolis. Naturally, I've suspended everyone until further notice. You're the only one I can trust; I want you to investigate. I'm going to the government to inform them of the danger. I'm not evacuating, so don't worry. I'll be back tomorrow." She gets up. "Now please hurry doctor. There's not a second to lose." You walk back to the foyer together then go your separate ways. [ACTION] south [STATE] Library Containing the sum total of fish knowledge, this library is the best in all Hydropolis. As fish only have small brains, it is on the smallish side, but students spend a lot of time here delving into what knowledge there is - even during rag week. The library's rarest book lies on a lectern close to the exit in the north wall. "Destroying library property, eh?" he continues, pushing you out into the corridor. "Sod off and don't come back." For some reason he doesn't take the page from you. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] Dr. Roach certainly knows how to build impressive machines - this one nearly fills the project room. It looks a bit like a huge aquarium, filled to the brim with multi-coloured gravel and, if you and Sir Playfair have anything to do with it, it's going to save Hydropolis from water evaporation. It almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. It contains a stream accelerator. [ACTION] examine accelerator [STATE] Dr. Roach certainly knows how to build impressive machines - this one nearly fills the project room. It looks a bit like a huge aquarium, filled to the brim with multi-coloured gravel and, if you and Sir Playfair have anything to do with it, it's going to save Hydropolis from water evaporation. It almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. It contains a stream accelerator. [ACTION] examine accelerator [STATE] The stream accelerator accelerates particles gathered by the main Project machine. There is a lok screw on it. [ACTION] unlock lok with hyperdriver [STATE] The stream accelerator accelerates particles gathered by the main Project machine. There is a lok screw on it. [ACTION] unlock lok with hyperdriver [STATE] There is no such lok. [ACTION] unlock lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] There is no such lok. [ACTION] unlock lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] You can't do that to the lok screw. [ACTION] unscrew lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] You can't do that to the lok screw. [ACTION] unscrew lok screw with hyperdriver [STATE] Frack, The Lokscrew(TM) was booby trapped! Bang it goes. Well "BANG!" really. Well, to be honest, it's even louder but you get the idea. Then, there's silence and blackness. Lots of it. Next, Sir Playfair says something. "I think you blew it. You must identify the saboteur. He'd know how to disarm the booby trap he set." The voice fades and you experience a new sensation, that of falling. There is a sudden woosh and you land, somewhat winded, back in the goldfish bowl. The castle has gone and someone has cleaned the bowl so you can see further than before. Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. The device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. Goldfish Bowl A tingle runs up and down your scales here. It's definitely not your vacation bowl. True, it does have gravel, ant eggs and pondweed, but then so has every goldfish bowl. The difference is you can see out of this bowl and it doesn't have a tacky plastic castle. It looks like you're in a computer room of some kind, with terminals lining the walls. [ACTION] drop hyperdriver [STATE] Frack, The Lokscrew(TM) was booby trapped! Bang it goes. Well "BANG!" really. [ACTION] southwest [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. [ACTION] west [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. [ACTION] west [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. Museum Station This station is the oldest in Hydropolis. The decoration reflects more decadent times, when men were men, fish were fish and they got together to build underground stations. An exit leads north to the museum while a funnel leads down to the platform. [ACTION] north [STATE] Museum Visited by many fish over the course of a year, the museum is a great attraction. Maybe this is due to its unique collection of piscean relics, the greatest of which is the skeleton of the 'Bloodyenormasaurus' which has pride of place in the centre of this room. You can explore the museum in your own time by going north, east or west. You can return to the station by swimming south. You put your tail down and refused. This room is white, and you don't like it. It leads north to the museum's finest exhibit and south back to the museum. [ACTION] open sachet [STATE] You tear open the sachet. The plankton escapes and starts to slowly disperse in the water around you. You notice how the plankton deflects the light as it spreads. If you act quickly you should be able to eat it before it disperses completely. Your mouth drops open in amazement. In the spreading cloud of plankton is the glimmering of myriad light beams - clearly the museum alarm system. Ahem! [ACTION] north [STATE] You tear open the sachet. There are no decorations, no features, no flaws, and yet the colours shift and swirl on every surface creating a hypnotic, soothing ambience. If you ever get the urge to leave, the exit is south. [ACTION] up [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. [ACTION] north [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] west [STATE] "Welcome to Battersea Power Station." You are met by a tall tour guide, who appears to be chewing gum and reading notes off little cue cards. She takes you on a guided tour of the entire plant, filling your head with facts and figures about throughput, power consumption and blades. One thing that stuck in your mind was the interesting, but little-known, fact that Battersea is only the secondary power station for Hydropolis and is only used during peak demand and to power the underground system. After about half an hour, she returns you to the power station. Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] west [STATE] The pressure door is closed to protect fish like you from swimming into the proximity of the fast moving blades which lie beyond. You may not appreciate this extra protection but I'm sure Dr. Roach is delighted. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] The pressure door is closed to protect fish like you from swimming into the proximity of the fast moving blades which lie beyond. You may not appreciate this extra protection but I'm sure Dr. Roach is delighted. [ACTION] turn off switch [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. Whoom! The pressure door opens. [ACTION] west [STATE] With great effort you manage to pull the switch. The light dims momentarily and the guppies on the guided tour scream until everything returns to normal. The important gauge shows a considerable drop in current. Whoom! The pressure door opens. [ACTION] west [STATE] Tunnel You'll have to be very careful in this tunnel; the sharp blades of a giant turbine are all around you. They aren't spinning but the turbine could start up again at any moment so it's important not to panic. Just make up your mind quickly whether you're going to swim east back to the power station or further along the tunnel to the west. There is a turbine here. [ACTION] west [STATE] Tunnel You'll have to be very careful in this tunnel; the sharp blades of a giant turbine are all around you. They aren't spinning but the turbine could start up again at any moment so it's important not to panic. Just make up your mind quickly whether you're going to swim east back to the power station or further along the tunnel to the west. There is a turbine here. [ACTION] west [STATE] Curve The tunnel curves upwards here through still, calm water, coming to a halt at a series of grilles. The turbine's sharp blades lie to the east. [ACTION] unscrew filter with screwdriver [STATE] Curve The tunnel curves upwards here through still, calm water, coming to a halt at a series of grilles. The turbine's sharp blades lie to the east. [ACTION] unscrew filter with screwdriver [STATE] The screw is a little sticky to begin with but after a good twist it loosens up. The screw drops into your hands and with a little extra pressure you remove the filter. [ACTION] east [STATE] The screw is a little sticky to begin with but after a good twist it loosens up. Just make up your mind quickly whether you're going to swim east back to the power station or further along the tunnel to the west. There is a turbine here. [ACTION] east [STATE] Power Station The power station dwarfs almost anything you have ever seen. Guided tours leave from the north, so the citizens of Hydropolis can marvel at this fish-made wonder and the sophistication of their engineers. A steel door lies to the west near an important gauge and a large switch. As you arrive Ernest Chub greets you cheerfully. [ACTION] south [STATE] Screwdriver dropped. [ACTION] south [STATE] Battersea Battersea is a place of dreams. The station was built many years ago to encourage visits by tourists. Regular tours around the complex leave from the north. An access funnel, leading down is fished by a guard who is checking tickets, or would be if there were any to check but the ticket clerk hasn't sold any. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Battersea. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Bertie Bream and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] time [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Bertie Bream and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] north [STATE] This fish has not been modified to swim through walls. [ACTION] north [STATE] You dart across Dace Road while nobody's looking. Plaza Noisy, dirty, fishy and grimy. Well, what did you expect a downtown Hydropolis shopping precinct to be like? You expected shops? OK, I'll give you some shops. To the north is a clothing shop, to the south is a pub and to the west is a cinema. Is that enough? No? Well, you'll have to go across Dace Road to the southeast if you want some more or northwest to Pickerel Underground Station if you want to go somewhere else. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] north [STATE] Suddenly, Bertie Bream gets very nervous and drags you away from the entrance. "I can't go in without a tie," he says, "what will everyone think of me?" He starts shaking uncontrollably. "You'll have to get me one," he quivers, "I can't swim anywhere right now." Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. Bertie Bream is here. [ACTION] north [STATE] The dark glasses and ear plugs provide just enough protection for the host-parasite interface from the flashing lights and heavy bass. You are completely safe. As long as you keep them on of course. Bertie Bream follows you in."Aghhh!" Bertie Bream screams and rushes from the disco. You quickly follow, just in time to see his body convulsing. There is a popping noise as something escapes through a warp hole then Bertie Bream collapses. You slap his gills to bring him round. "What happened?" he says, standing up, "I can hardly remember anything. But I did something bad to The Project. Something about stream regulators, stream accelerators, stream regimentors." "Go on," you say, "It's terribly important." "I can't remember," he pleads, getting delirious, "it's not my fault, I really can't. I need a shower. I feel dirty." He rushes off before you can stop him. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. [ACTION] down [STATE] Opah Station Commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. [ACTION] down [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Opah University. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. You notice a guppy flounder around for a bit and then swim off. The last few fish, pilchards by the look of them, squeeze onto the train. "Mind the doors," shouts the guard as they close. The train clatters off into the tunnel. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. [ACTION] south [STATE] Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. An underground train is here but looks likely to leave at any moment. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] west [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy cylinder [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Pub The Hook, Line and Sinker is a good old-fashioned boozer, with a clean bar and filthy customers. One of them, a sorry drunk leaning unsteadily against the bar, seems familiar to your host. Steve, the cool catfish from the second hand shop, is serving behind the bar. Or is it his twin brother? He sells masks, filled with gas from behind the bar, for the customers to sniff. Hence, the masks are known to the locals as "snifters" and the state of drunkeness as being "sniffed to the gills" or "completely finless". Exits lead north and east. An interesting looking cylinder is behind the bar. There is a stool here. As you arrive Ernest Chub and Simon Tench greet you cheerfully. [ACTION] buy cylinder [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] With what? [ACTION] buy cylinder with fisa [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. "Well, you really messed that up," Sir Playfair scolds. "The cylinder must be important otherwise they wouldn't have stolen it. Fortunately, the back room boys got a fix on him. He's somewhere in the dimensions. You'll have to go after him, Agent 10, and be careful this time." You hear him mumbling in the background then he curtly says, "A warp will open up in Dr. Roach's apartment. Use that. Panchax out." You should be more careful if you want to keep your job. [ACTION] east [STATE] "That will be 99 clams, me old mate." says Steve. He gives you the cylinder and charges the purchase to your Fisa account. A drunk with his left arm in a sling lurches into you as you turn round from the bar, knocking the cylinder to the floor. "Sorry guv," he slurs, picking it up, "I'll get you another one." "It's one of the Fins! Stop him Agent 10," screams Sir Playfair in your brain as the drunk runs off with the cylinder. You swim frantically after him but he disappears. "Well, you really messed that up," Sir Playfair scolds. "The cylinder must be important otherwise they wouldn't have stolen it. Fortunately, the back room boys got a fix on him. He's somewhere in the dimensions. You'll have to go after him, Agent 10, and be careful this time." You hear him mumbling in the background then he curtly says, "A warp will open up in Dr. Roach's apartment. Use that. Panchax out." You should be more careful if you want to keep your job. [ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] My, Plaice Street is busy! In the end you succeed in crossing. Dace Road You are swimming along the south side of Dace Road. The police station is to the south, west across Plaice Street is a pub, and east lies Shark Street. [ACTION] east [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] Shark Street This is the seedier part of town with shops to match, so watch who you're dealing with. South is a music shop, north is a second hand shop, across the road to the east is the hardware shop and southeast is the nearest underground station, Eelpout. Dace Road, a much safer place to be, is to the west. [ACTION] southeast [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Eelpout Underground Station In the ticket hall, commuters are busily swimming up and down the access funnel which leads to the platform. The ticket counter stands in the centre with a clerk behind it. Northwest an exit leads out onto Shark Street. [ACTION] down [STATE] The traffic on Shark Street is really busy but eventually you notice a small gap and swim hastily across. Platform The tracks, leading off into the dark tunnel, lie beyond the northern edge of the platform. Trains arrive quite frequently, once every three minutes on average, a fact not unnoticed by the section of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company responsible for advertising. You can go up to ground level via the access funnel to Eelpout. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You show your pass to the guard and go through. You feel a gusting current from the tunnel as a train clatters into the station. The doors open and fish push and shove each other as they get on and off. [ACTION] north [STATE] You squeeze your way, sardine like, onto the train with the other commuters. Tube Always busy, the tube trains are packed solid with guppies. Rules have been passed strictly governing the number of fish allowed in each carriage but these are often disregarded, especially by sardines and pilchards. "All aboard," shouts the guard. Some dolphins rush in where angelfish fear to tread. The doors close and the train accelerates out of the station. The ticket clerk, sitting behind a counter, looks quite scared by the mad rush too. You can get back to the street westward, but you'd be swimming against the tide of commuters. [ACTION] north [STATE] Paddlington This is the up and coming place to live in Hydropolis. It's also one of the busiest, teaming with guppies. Your apartment block is to the north and the entrance to the underground station bearing the logo of the Hydropolis Underground Omnibus Company stands to the east. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lobby With no security guard, no intercom and no doors, any old eel could slip in here and break into every apartment in the block. It's a wonder it hasn't happened yet! Mind you, it wouldn't be all bad. At least Dr. Roach could get some new furniture with the insurance money. The exit out to Paddlington is to the south and the access shaft leads up to the landing. [ACTION] north [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. Anyway, he managed to get a view of Hydropolis - not many places have even that. The room is decorated in a minimalist style but, as Dr. Roach would say if he weren't under your control, "I am a man of minimal needs." The only excesses he has allowed himself are a painting, a trendy black shelf, a switch to control the lights and, most important, a door to get out. Oh, no! You've been burgled! I hope Dr. Roach was insured. There is a dark warp and a fishton here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] Lounge Some would call this apartment small and pretentious, but with house prices in Hydropolis the way they are, small and pretentious was all Dr. Roach could afford. I hope Dr. Roach was insured. There is a dark warp and a fishton here. [ACTION] enter dark warp [STATE] You slip through the dark warp into the whirling dimensions. "It's a strange place Agent 10," says Sir Playfair's voice in the back of your brain. "Those Fins have twisted the dimensions into some kind of labyrinth, but it isn't normal. The back room boys are busy trying to figure it out. All they can tell me is that the Fins have hidden the cylinder in a place where the only way out is up and that if you're left in a room with no exits you'll be stuck there until we can get you out, which may well be too late to save Hydropolis. You'll have to watch your step, Agent 10; we don't want to lose you, old boy. Good luck. Panchax out." In The Dimensions A lesser being would have no idea what's going on here. Their brains would probably get lightly scrambled if not completely fizzled out. But, for a highly trained inter-dimensional espionage operative, who has spent half his life travelling through the dimensions, exits are easy to spot. Exits lead east, southeast, northwest, up. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] east [STATE] Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] put new card in slot [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. [ACTION] put new card in slot [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] north [STATE] The card fits neatly into the slot. After a few reassuring buzzes the door slides open smoothly and the card is returned to your waiting hand. [ACTION] north [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Research Wing This is where a lot of the groundwork for The Project was done by the famous Dr. Salmon. Unfortunately his work was shelved to make room for your endeavours, and anyway he sniffed far too much. You can swim up into the tower from here or pass through the metal door with a slot beside it to the south. There is a crystal tuna here. After allowing time for someone to pass the door closes. [ACTION] up [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] time [STATE] Tower Water must be evaporating fast; the tower is only half full! You swim up and break the surface to take a look around. In the ceiling, high above through the air, is a trapdoor, but there seems no way of getting there. You dive quickly back underwater before your gills dry out. [ACTION] time [STATE] The time is 14:39 [ACTION] open cylinder [STATE] The time is 14:39 [ACTION] open cylinder [STATE] The bag inflates and you hold it tightly closed to prevent the gas escaping. You rise up through the tower. There is a loud bang as you pass through the trap door, opening it. The roof of the tower lies inches below you but you are drifting slowly upwards. Roof When there was a lot of water around, students came up here to watch the teeming city of Hydropolis. A railing around the edge of the roof was put here to prevent them being washed away by the deceptively strong overcurrent. Now the water has gone that has ceased to be a problem. The obvious exit is the trapdoor. There is a photon bridge and some railings here. [ACTION] drop bag [STATE] The bag inflates and you hold it tightly closed to prevent the gas escaping. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You release the bag, and it floats gently up into the sky. [ACTION] get bridge [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] You have now got the photon bridge. [ACTION] enter railings [STATE] You slide through the railings with your gills about to burst. Roach has never practiced falling before, it's a good job your training as an inter-dimensional espionage operative has given you the experience to be able to survive under such difficult circumstances. You hit the water below the tower making a dramatic entrance to Opah. Several of the students applaud your efforts. Opah If things want learning in Hydropolis, then Opah University is where they get learned. The university disco to the north is in the middle of a bop-til-you-drop rag week stunt with schools of tired students swimming in and out to the heavy four-four beat. An expensive restaurant lies to the south. Have you made a reservation? No? Too bad. It's very popular. An impressive archway leads east into the university itself. You can return to Opah tube station by going west. A statue of the university founder is in the middle of the quad. [ACTION] east [STATE] University Foyer The foyer is lined with ancient busts of important looking fish from the university's past, an ugly bunch of egg-headed reprobates if ever you saw some. West, an impressive arch will take you out of the university. A corridor continues east, and a metal door blocks any access to the north. The principal's office is to the south. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor Windows line the north wall of this corridor which continues east and west. They look out onto the quad, and stream light on to an archway which leads south to the library. [ACTION] east [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. A metal door to the east prevents you from swimming directly into your laboratory and the corridor returns west. There is a brass screw and a lok screw here. A student sidles up to you. "We've got the principal," he whispers, "if you don't donate to rag week we'll let her go." You hastily decide to give them all your loose change, then realise you have none. They refuse to take your credit card and swim off, laughing. [ACTION] put tatty card in slot [STATE] Corridor My worm, it's dark in this corridor. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. There is a hyperdriver and the device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel here. Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine wallchart [STATE] You get off. Store Room Even though Dr. Roach is very clean and tidy, the same cannot be said of the rest of the team. They've made this the messiest store room in the university. And it's always left for you to straighten things out. All the equipment and spares needed for The Project are usually stashed here, with a wallchart keeping track of what's in and out of stock. The only exit leads northwest. There is a protocopier here. [ACTION] examine wallchart [STATE] The wallchart is an informal record of the equipment held in store for The Project. [ACTION] read wallchart [STATE] The wallchart is an informal record of the equipment held in store for The Project. [ACTION] read wallchart [STATE] A: filter (out of stock) B: photon bridge (out of stock) C: focus wheel (out of stock) D: tuned crystal (out of stock) E: a suitable case (out of stock) F: shelf (out of stock) G: wallplan (1 in stock) [ACTION] join filter to focus wheel [STATE] A: filter (out of stock) B: photon bridge (out of stock) C: focus wheel (out of stock) D: tuned crystal (out of stock) E: a suitable case (out of stock) F: shelf (out of stock) G: wallplan (1 in stock) [ACTION] join filter to focus wheel [STATE] You can't see a wheel here. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] You can't see a wheel here. [ACTION] northwest [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. Exits are northeast, southeast and west through the metal door to the corridor. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Laboratory This lab is exceptionally clean. Dr. Roach must be remarkably fastidious. The water is constantly decontaminated and recycled to protect The Project equipment and your terminal from damage by grit, fluff and dirt. Exits are northeast, southeast and west through the metal door to the corridor. [ACTION] northeast [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. There is a hyperdriver and the device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel here. [ACTION] break box with hyperdriver [STATE] Project Room Considering how important this place is for the future of all fishkind, you are stunned by how little has been done to make it look significant. A lick of paint, although distasteful for the fish licking it on, wouldn't have gone amiss. The only exit is southwest. There is a hyperdriver and the device almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel here. [ACTION] break box with hyperdriver [STATE] You hack the box to bits and break the hyperdriver in the process. The focus wheel falls to the floor. [ACTION] join filter to focus wheel [STATE] You hack the box to bits and break the hyperdriver in the process. The focus wheel falls to the floor. [ACTION] join filter to focus wheel [STATE] Well done! The focus wheel connects to the filter making a focus filter. [ACTION] join photon bridge to tuned crystal [STATE] Well done! The focus wheel connects to the filter making a focus filter. [ACTION] join photon bridge to tuned crystal [STATE] Brilliant! The photon bridge and the tuned crystal seem to meld before your eyes leaving you with a crystal bridge. [ACTION] join focus filter to crystal bridge [STATE] Brilliant! The photon bridge and the tuned crystal seem to meld before your eyes leaving you with a crystal bridge. [ACTION] join focus filter to crystal bridge [STATE] Ah, such dexterity. You have made the only crystal filter in fish world. [ACTION] examine crystal filter [STATE] Ah, such dexterity. You have made the only crystal filter in fish world. [ACTION] examine crystal filter [STATE] The crystal filter gathers energy from various sources which it filters and refines. [ACTION] join crystal filter to case [STATE] The crystal filter gathers energy from various sources which it filters and refines. [ACTION] join crystal filter to case [STATE] Congratulations! The two items fuse to form a stream regulator! [ACTION] examine stream regulator [STATE] Congratulations! The two items fuse to form a stream regulator! [ACTION] examine stream regulator [STATE] The stream regulator controls the flow of particles from one dimension to another. [ACTION] put regulator in device [STATE] The stream regulator controls the flow of particles from one dimension to another. [ACTION] put regulator in device [STATE] The stream regulator is now inside the device. [ACTION] turn on device [STATE] The stream regulator is now inside the device. [ACTION] turn on device [STATE] Hey, I really dig you device. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] Hey, I really dig you device. [ACTION] examine device [STATE] Dr. Roach certainly knows how to build impressive machines - this one nearly fills the project room. It looks a bit like a huge aquarium, filled to the brim with multi-coloured gravel and, if you and Sir Playfair have anything to do with it, it's going to save Hydropolis from water evaporation. It almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. It contains a stream regulator. [ACTION] get device [STATE] Dr. Roach certainly knows how to build impressive machines - this one nearly fills the project room. It looks a bit like a huge aquarium, filled to the brim with multi-coloured gravel and, if you and Sir Playfair have anything to do with it, it's going to save Hydropolis from water evaporation. It almost fills the room, looking like an aquarium filled with multi-coloured gravel. It contains a stream regulator. [ACTION] get device [STATE] The device steadfastly refuses to be moved. [ACTION] activate device [STATE] The device steadfastly refuses to be moved. [ACTION] activate device [STATE] I don't understand activate [ACTION] examine regulator [STATE] I don't understand activate [ACTION] examine regulator [STATE] The stream regulator controls the flow of particles from one dimension to another. [ACTION] attach regulator with lok screw [STATE] The stream regulator controls the flow of particles from one dimension to another. [ACTION] attach regulator with lok screw [STATE] The Lokscrew(TM) snaps resolutely into place. It seems you have done all you need to do to save Hydropolis so you rest on your laurels for a while, then your laurels start to ache so you start filing your credentials when suddenly... Nothing happened. It's four o'clock, the Project has been activated and nothing happened. You did it! You saved Hydropolis! It's time for celebration, time to party! But professionals don't party; they leave that to the Dr. Roaches of this dimension. You return to Mission HQ, to a hero's de-briefing from Sir Playfair Panchax. "Absolutely splendid job, Agent 10," he chuffs, "a marvellous piece of work. One of your finest missions. As a reward, we at the Department, are allowing you three month's vacation with a goldfish of your choice." He winks. "And we guarantee no interruptions this time." You are warped off to a spacious, warm aquarium with all the pondweed, ant eggs and gravel you could want. And of course, the most beautiful creature in all the dimensions to spend time with. After three months of this kind of pleasure, you might not be up to another mission... Your score is 491 out of 501. Do you want to quit or restart (q/r)? [ACTION] r [STATE] The Lokscrew(TM) snaps resolutely into place.
